Author: kolo#1111
Content:
@Notary-Operator just a bit of corrections:
- You need to have folder named after your team (not `komodo-cats-team` but just `cats` - exactly as your node will be named in pubkeys list except region _XX) inside `notarynodes` folder. 
- This is not proposals listing, this is any team getinfo page, that will persist after elections. Way to get information on any node, team or operator. It doesn't matter if there are folders of team with  no nodes, with only proposal or from mature heads like badass. There is also my cat's page. Having folder there doesn't affect elections (not having it affects  :)
- Please, DO NOT remove non-yours old folders, do not touch proposals directory (some might need it to recover their old data), do not commit to other folders there or change files structure.

And you have to make page. It is one and only *official* source of candidates data.

Spoiler: pages deadline 1 april. Declaring automatic re-elected nodes between 1st and 14th apr. Votes airdrop 14th apr, voting deadline 14th may, hardforking pubkeys - mid june. 30 nodes will be re-elected, 30 nodes elected, 4 dev nodes. Top 30 (from all) re-elected nodes define count of free per region spots. I will announce that all soon.

Author: kolo#1111
Content:
Please, forgive not always answering long and detailed. Multiwindow battling on how it should be done is a bit too late. We promised not to change any rules significantly since last year.
Will have hours to explain everyone asking why something is done the way it's done, but after elections üòÉ

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @kolo I am going to try to interpret your "Top 30 (from all) re-elected nodes define count of free per region spots" statement, because it has people confused, but I *think* I know what you mean

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: of all nodes who are re-elected (top half of each region), place the top 30 into each of the 4 regions. The empty spots left behind define how many empty slots are in that specific region

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @kolo some people think you are saying "the top 30 nodes globally get re-elected", which would be a big change from what was said previously

Author: Strob#3417
Content: I will follow this election this year, sounds exciting! How many candidates are you expecting this year? Last year there were only 50 right? I may even be greatly interested in running a node myself one day since I do have plenty of powerful servers doing mostly nothing since I switched my render farm from cpu to gpu and since Komodo recently became such a passion for me. How much time should a notary node operator expect to have to put in his node maintenance? I run a node for Ravencoin (no reward, just for fun) but this is so easy I won't even compare it to a KMD NN.

Author: Mylo#8306
Content:
"Lazy" operator, average, excellent about 20,50,100+ hrs per month.
First year learning curve is high.
Also depends how much scripting and tuning you do to continually optimize and compete.

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: They are conservative estimates.

Author: Dr.Terminus#3269
Content: I am an experienced and self sufficient systems / networking admin as well as an effective project planner and service responder. Graduated college over 12 years ago now and I've been operating as an independent contractor ever since. I've spent this time specializing in selling, planning, installing, configuring, calibrating, networking, securing, servicing and troubleshooting HIPPA compliant systems. I've never had a boss, just a handful of regular trusting and happy clients. I'm very happy to make myself part of the KMD community efforts by assisting newcomers where and when possible across a full range of potential matters which I might contribute advice towards drawn from years of real world experience. I joined this KMD discord channel within the first day it came online and can be counted on to remain present and involved here throughout NN upkeep. I'm ready and willing to work hard to keep a single node up and running at it's best. I'm a true KMD believer. Currently holding as much as I can afford to but will need help from community to get enough votes to earn a node.
